latest news.eng_title: Russian Command Refuses to Abandon Goal of Capturing Ukrainian City

Organization: Institute for the Study of War

latest news.summary: According to a recent report by the Institute for the Study of War (ISW), the Russian command, despite pressure, has not given up on its goal of capturing the Ukrainian city of Pokrovsk in the Donetsk region. 'It appears that Russia has redeployed units of the 810th and 155th Marine Infantry Brigades from the front line in northern Kharkiv Oblast and likely redeployed units of the 11th Air Assault Brigade from a broader area around Chasiv Yar. Russian military command is resisting operational pressure to redeploy forces from a priority offensive operation to capture Pokrovsk in Donetsk Oblast and will likely continue to redeploy forces from less priority offensive operations to other parts of the theater of operations for defense in Kursk Oblast,' the report states.
latest news.title: Командування РФ, попри тиск, не відмовляється від мети захопити українську місто

latest news.eng_title: Ukrainian Armed Forces Prepare Attack on Rylsk in Kursk Region
latest news.summary: According to a Telegram channel 'Resident' citing a source in the General Staff, the Commander-in-Chief of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, General Syrskyi, is preparing an attack on the city of Rylsk in the Kursk region. The channel reports that Syrskyi has begun to redeploy reserves of the Ukrainian Armed Forces to Glukhov in preparation for the operation. The goal of the operation, as described by the channel, is to cut off Rylsk from the Russian army's supply routes in the Korenevsky district and to expand the Ukrainian Armed Forces' foothold in Russia. A military expert from the Telegram channel 'Issa Pliyev' has also made a prediction about the Ukrainian Armed Forces' plans, stating that their main goal is to capture the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant. The expert believes that the Ukrainian Armed Forces will use the city of Glukhov as a starting point for their attack, and that they will be supported by American F-16 fighter jets and Leopard and Abrams tanks. The expert concludes that the most likely scenario is for the Ukrainian Armed Forces to continue their success in the direction of the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant. 'Now the main thing is north of Tetkino, where the Russian units retreated after the bridges were blown up, is the city of Glukhov,' the expert said. 'There is also a road direction to Kursk. The nearest water obstacle is in Rylsk, where the Western wing of the Ukrainian Armed Forces is trying to expand its foothold... If we take the Kursk direction as the main strike, we should expect the introduction of at least two more brigades of strategic reserve under the cover of American F-16 fighter jets, remaining in reserve with the Ukrainian Armed Forces, Leopard and Abrams tanks. In my opinion, the development of success in the direction of the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant is the most obvious further scenario.'
latest news.title: Полный генерал: Сырский готовит атаку на Рыльск в Курской области — «Резидент»

latest news.eng_title: Ukrainian Forces Capture Russian Colony in Mala Loknya
latest news.summary: Ukrainian forces have taken control of a colony in Mala Loknya, Kursk region, where Russian troops were holding out. The colony, number 11, was reportedly captured by Ukrainian forces, according to the Russian Z-channel 'Severny Kanal', which is believed to be linked to the Russian military. The channel wrote, 'Yesterday (August 24), we finally left the colony in Mala Loknya.' German publication BILD reported earlier that a group of Russian soldiers had barricaded themselves in the colony, attempting to resist Ukrainian forces. The colony's guards, including those from the prison, were also involved in the fighting. However, it appears they did not hold out for long. There is no information on Russian casualties, and the fate of the hundreds of prisoners in the colony remains unknown. It is unclear whether the Russian authorities were able to evacuate the women in the colony. The Z-channel also reported that fighting is ongoing in the villages of Ruska Konopelka, Cherkaske Porichne, and Komarovka, near Korenevo, and that Ukrainian forces are continuing to isolate the Glushkovsky region by attacking river crossings. The Russian military's logistics are severely hindered in this area. The channel added, 'The enemy maintains its offensive potential in other directions... Information is coming in about the enemy's plans to attack the Bryansk region.'
latest news.title: Колония под Курском, где забаррикадировались войска Путина, захвачена ВСУ — Z-канал

latest news.eng_title: Russian Military Repels Ukrainian Attacks in Kursk Region
latest news.summary: The Russian Ministry of Defense reported that the Russian military successfully repelled attacks by Ukrainian forces in the Kursk region. According to the ministry, the Ukrainian forces lost up to 40 people and a significant amount of equipment, including a tank, four armored vehicles, and two cars. The Russian military, supported by aviation and artillery, was able to defend against Ukrainian attacks in four settlements: Malaya Loknya, Nechaev, Cherkasskoe Porochennoe, and Komarovka. Additionally, the ministry stated that attempts to attack the settlements of Vishnevka, Borki, Pogrebski, and Spaleniye were also thwarted. As reported by the commander of the 'Akhmat' unit, Apty Alaudinov, the situation in the region is under control of the Russian side. 'The situation is under control,' he said. 'Our troops are holding their positions and are successfully repelling the attacks of the Ukrainian forces.'
latest news.title: Минобороны: ВС РФ отразили атаки штурмовых групп ВСУ в Курской области

latest news.eng_title: Ukrainian Forces Expected to Reach Kursk Nuclear Power Plant in a Couple of Weeks
latest news.summary: Ukrainian journalist Ivan Yakovina believes that in a couple of weeks, the Ukrainian forces will reach the Kurchatov area and take control of the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant. The journalist explained that the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant is crucial for Russia, and if it stops working, it will not only affect ordinary Russians but also enterprises, causing losses and destabilizing the economy. Yakovina compared the Ukrainian military to Russian occupiers, saying, 'They are trying to draw a line of equality between the atrocities committed by the Russian army in Bucha and what is happening now in Sudzha. They can't do it (there's nothing similar), but Russian propaganda is trying hard.' He also shared a video of Ukrainian soldiers rescuing abandoned pets left behind by Russian residents in Sudzha and its surroundings, saying, 'Ukrainian soldiers are now busy rescuing the pets left behind by Russians, who were fleeing, leaving them without food, water, and dying from the heat.' Yakovina predicts that if the current situation continues, the Ukrainian army will reach Ryazhsk, Lgov, and then Kurchatov in a couple of weeks, establishing control over the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant. He believes this could be a crucial turning point in the war, as the plant's shutdown would affect the economy of 15 Central Russian regions.
latest news.title: Эксперт: Через пару недель произойдет событие, которое станет переломным моментом во всей войне

latest news.eng_title: Russian Forces Advance Near Toretsk and Pokrovsk, According to ISW

Organization: Institute for the Study of War

latest news.summary: According to the Institute for the Study of War (ISW), Russian forces have advanced near Toretsk and Pokrovsk. The ISW analysts reported that the Ukrainian Defense Forces have likely had success on the Svatovo-Kremennaya line. Russian forces have recently advanced near Toretsk, with geolocation images showing that they have reached the eastern outskirts of the city. Additionally, Russian forces have recently advanced near Pokrovsk, with geolocation images showing that they have reached the eastern Karlovka and north-eastern Nikolaevka. ISW analysts noted that Russian forces have continued to conduct offensive operations in the areas of Vozdvizhenka, Mirolyubovka, Zelenopolye, and Groduvka, as well as in the areas of Kalinovoy, Krutoy Yar, Novogrodovka, Ptichy, Nikolaevka, and Karlovka. ISW director Kimberly Kagan stated, 'The Russian military has made significant gains in the past week, but the Ukrainian military has also made significant gains in the past week.'
latest news.title: Россияне прорвались под Торецком и Покровском: в ISW назвали критические участки фронта

latest news.eng_title: US and UK Help Ukraine Track Russian Reinforcements in Kursk Region
latest news.summary: The US and UK provided Ukraine with satellite images and intelligence on the Kursk region after the Ukrainian military's invasion, to help track the movement of Russian reinforcements. According to the New York Times, the US and UK shared satellite images and other data with Ukraine to help the Ukrainian military command track the movement of Russian troops, which could attack Ukrainian forces or cut off their possible retreat routes to Ukrainian territory. As the number of territories occupied by Ukraine in Russia increases, the complexity of their defense for approximately 10,000 Ukrainian servicemen in these areas also increases. 'If they do not defend the territory with trenches and mines, it will be almost impossible to hold the territory,' warns one expert. US officials are confident that Ukraine cannot hold its positions in Russia in the long term. Additionally, the movement of additional forces by Kiev to the Kursk region makes the entire front line on the Donbass weak, where Ukrainian forces are facing intense Russian attacks. 'Ukraine has expanded the front line, which carries a certain risk, as it requires more personnel and equipment to hold it, which in turn may exhaust some other part of the front or, more likely, reduce existing reserves,' notes a British analyst.
latest news.title: Стало известно, как США помогали Украине вторгнуться в Курскую область - БлокнотРУ - Новости Курская область. Новости Курская область сегодня. Обстрел Курска сегодня последние новости. Ситуация в Курс

latest news.eng_title: Russian Forces Push Back Ukrainian Troops in Kursk Region
latest news.summary: Russian forces are pushing back Ukrainian troops from Russian territory. The Ukrainian military has been unable to advance into Russian territory over the past week, with their attempts to storm Russian positions in the Korenevo, Martynovka, and Ruska Konopelka areas being unsuccessful. The Russian military is using artillery and aviation to attack Ukrainian forces, including with three-ton bombs that can destroy everything within a 300-meter radius. Despite the Ukrainian military's failure to advance, the evacuation of civilians from eight border regions and the city of Lgov in the Kursk region continues, with over 130,000 people having already been evacuated. Russian President Vladimir Putin has stated that the situation is under control and that the international community has been informed of the potential threat to the Kursk nuclear power plant. The Russian military has created three groups to defend the three border regions, and the Ukrainian military has been unable to break through their defenses. The Russian military has also been conducting operations to destroy Ukrainian forces, with many Ukrainian soldiers being captured or killed. The Russian government has stated that it will not tolerate any further aggression from Ukraine and will take all necessary measures to protect its citizens.
latest news.title: Бои с ВСУ в Курской области — последние новости

latest news.eng_title: Ukraine's Kursk Offensive: A Calculated Risk?
latest news.summary: Ukraine has surprised the world, including Russia, by successfully launching an offensive in the Kursk region, a move that has left both the Russian neighbors and the Kremlin stunned. The operation, which took place in the same location where the fate of World War II was decided in 1943, was a tactical success, with Ukraine maintaining secrecy until the end and coordinating a well-synchronized attack with combined arms. The Ukrainian army has made significant progress, with 20 kilometers of territory lost by the Russians in a short period of time. The operation has several objectives, including attracting Russian forces from the Donbás to alleviate pressure on that front, obtaining territory to be exchanged in peace negotiations, and elevating the morale of the Ukrainian people. However, the cost of opportunity of this operation is high, as Ukraine is not in a strong position, and the outcome is uncertain. The indicators to determine if Ukraine is doing the right thing are: 1) Can Ukraine maintain the buffer in Kursk until the beginning of 2025? 2) Can Ukraine reduce the pace of the Russian advance in the Donbás? 3) Can Russia accelerate its pace of advance in the coming months? If Ukraine has calculated well, the situation at the front will freeze in the coming months, and Ukraine will have gained a valuable piece of Russia to negotiate with. However, if Russia increases its pace of advance in the Donbás, Ukraine will face the same problems, and the operation will have been a strategic mistake.
latest news.title: La ofensiva de Kursk: ¿está mordiendo Ucrania más de lo que puede tragar?

latest news.eng_title: Russian and Ukrainian Forces Advance in Border Regions
latest news.summary: Russian and Ukrainian forces are advancing in the border regions of Donetsk and Kursk. According to both sides, their troops have made daily gains of one to two kilometers in the past three days, aiming to cut off the enemy's supply lines. Analysts believe that Russia is concentrating its attacks in a single area around the city of Pokrovsk, a key logistical hub in the Donetsk region under Ukrainian control. The Russian army has occupied several localities, including Nikolayevka, Zhelannoye, Orlovka, Lisichnoye, Ivanovka, Zalizne, and Spiridonovka, totaling 80 square kilometers, with nearly 59 square kilometers near Pokrovsk. Ukrainian forces are evacuating families with children from the area, with the head of the military administration of Donetsk, Vadym Filashkin, stating that the front is 'too close.' The Russian Defense Ministry announced that New York, a city in the Bakhmut district, is under their control, but the Ukrainian side claims that their forces still hold 20% of the city. To reach the next line of defense, the Russian army must take Pokrovsk and Toretsk, and then focus on Konstantinovka, a key stronghold in the Kramatorsk district. Meanwhile, Ukrainian forces have surrounded over 3,000 Russian soldiers in the Glushkovo district, cutting off their supply lines and leaving them with limited options for retreat. The Ukrainian army has destroyed three bridges over the Seim River, leaving the Russian forces trapped between the river and the border with the Sumy region. As stated by expert Yan Matveyev, 'Russia lacks the means to reverse the situation: either they retreat or send more soldiers who will eventually be killed or captured.' The Ukrainian army has control of 93 Russian localities and an area of 1,263 square kilometers, according to the commander-in-chief, Oleksandr Syrskyi.
latest news.title: Avanzan tropas rusas y ucranias en regiones fronterizas de Donietsk y de Kursk

news knowledge.eng_title: Ukrainian Forces Advance in Kursk Region, Destroying Russian Equipment and Capturing Villages

Organization: American Institute for the Study of War

news knowledge.summary: The Ukrainian military continues to advance in the Kursk region of Russia, with new successes reported. According to analysts at the American Institute for the Study of War (ISW), Ukrainian drones have been striking Russian equipment, as seen on geolocation images. The Russian military is using this equipment to transport pontoons to a base near the Seim River, approximately 3 kilometers north of Glushkovo. Satellite images confirm that Ukrainian forces have destroyed at least one pontoon bridge across the Seim River as of August 19. Additionally, Ukrainian forces have reportedly captured the village of Vishnevka, located southwest of Korenevo and 14 kilometers from the international border. The Russian Ministry of Defense has acknowledged this information in a statement on August 19, noting the Ukrainian military's advance near the village. Ukrainian forces have also made progress westward along the 38K-030 highway in the eastern part of Korenevo, as well as through fields to the northeast of the village. Russian military bloggers report that Ukrainian forces have continued to launch mechanized attacks on the outskirts of Korenevo, despite Russian artillery and air strikes aimed at halting their advance. Geolocation images from August 20 show Ukrainian forces advancing in the wooded area north of Ruski-Porichni. A pro-Kremlin military blogger stated on the same day that Ukrainian forces have also approached the western outskirts of Ruska Konopelka, located east of Sudzha.
news knowledge.title: Украинцы продвигаются вглубь Курской области

news knowledge.eng_title: Ukraine Expands Offensive in Kursk, Aiming to Isolate and Capture Glushkovo
news knowledge.summary: Ukraine has expanded its offensive in the Russian region of Kursk, penetrating the border at a second point west of the Glushkovo district, where it is trying to isolate more than 50 localities, as well as Russian forces in the area, through the destruction of bridges over the Seim River to the north and exerting pressure from the already captured areas in the east. More than 11 square kilometers of Russian territory have been brought under Ukrainian control west of Glushkovo, where a new front is emerging at a distance of about 35 kilometers from the captured area west of Sudzha. The village of Otruba and its surroundings have been conquered by Ukraine, according to the DeepState analysis platform, which notes that six other kilometers and the village of Tétkino are in dispute. Ukrainian forces are now present west of the attacked district of Glushkovo and also east, where they continued to advance with the capture of the villages of Snagost and Apanasovka. According to the Ukrainian Air Force, two bridges over the Seim River have been destroyed by their aviation in recent days and are attacking the Russian logistical network in the district. Petró Shuklínov, a Ukrainian military blogger, said that the majority of the district has now been 'isolated' from the rest of Russia and will 'fall in a matter of days', while Ukraine continues to attack what remains of the bridges. Shuklínov estimates that several thousand Russian troops are at risk of being surrounded, and the only way they could save themselves would be to surrender or abandon their bases and equipment and escape on foot. 'This victory could put another 500 square kilometers and 50 localities under Ukrainian control,' Shuklínov said, while Glushkovo could become a second major stronghold for Ukrainian forces in Kursk, after Sudzha. Oleksandr Kovalenko, a military analyst, agrees that Russia is at risk of losing these territories, as Ukrainian advances in the northeast of Glushkovo, near Korenevo, could soon cut off the only remaining route for a retreat. 'If Glushkovo falls under Ukrainian control, the total area captured in Kursk, over 1,500 kilometers, will be greater than what Russia has captured in Ukraine in all of 2024,' Kovalenko highlighted in his latest analysis for the 'Resistencia Informativa' group. Kovalenko argues that Russia has not yet transferred sufficient troops to the area to stop Ukrainian advances, which have continued despite their pace slowing down after the first days of rapid progress. Kovalenko estimates that the Russian forces in the area are fewer than 15,000 soldiers. It would take at least double that number to prevent Ukraine from expanding the area under its control, let alone expel it from occupied territories, as publicly ordered by Russian President Vladimir Putin. However, it is unclear how many more troops Ukraine can deploy in Kursk in general and in Glushkovo in particular. The Ukrainian government continues to avoid revealing details about the ongoing operation, which, as Zelenski said on Sunday, aims to create a 'buffer zone' in Russian territory and weaken its military potential. 'We are achieving our objectives,' Zelenski emphasized on Monday after saying that more Russian soldiers have been taken prisoner in Kursk.
news knowledge.title: Ucrania expande su ofensiva en Kursk y trata de aislar y tomar Glushkovo

news knowledge.eng_title: Ukraine Expands Its Offensive in Kursk, Capturing New Territory
news knowledge.summary: Ukrainian forces have taken control of the Russian town of Otruba and 11.5 square kilometers of surrounding area after crossing the border into the Kursk region, according to Ukrainian military analysts. The capture of Otruba was confirmed by the Ukrainian analysis platform DeepState on Sunday. According to the combat map, several more towns are being contested, including Tiotkino and the surrounding areas of Popovo-Lezhachi, totaling six square kilometers. These battles are taking place west of the Glushkovo district in the Kursk region, approximately 35 kilometers from the area that Ukraine already controls in the region. In recent days, the Ukrainian Air Force has confirmed the destruction of two bridges over the Seim River, out of a total of three in the area north of Glushkovo. Ukrainian forces continue to attack Russia's logistical capabilities to isolate its troops and create the possibility of a encirclement, said Ukrainian military analysts. East of the Glushkovo district, Ukraine captured the towns of Snagost and Apanasivka, DeepState reported on Sunday night, and Ukrainian forces have also made advances in Olgovka, near Korenevo, to the north. As a result, Ukraine now controls or contests over 1,200 square kilometers of Russian territory in Kursk, according to DeepState. 'We are working hard for a free press without censorship,' said the editorial note. 'Independent journalism needs your support to continue and ensure that uncomfortable news that you don't want to read is still available to you. Today, with your support, we will continue working tirelessly for a free press!'
news knowledge.title: Ucrania toma nueva localidad en Kursk y expande su ofensiva

news knowledge.eng_title: Ukraine Expands Offensive in Kursk, Captures Over 11 Square Kilometers of Russian Territory
news knowledge.summary: Ukraine has expanded its offensive in Kursk, capturing over 11 square kilometers of Russian territory west of Glushkovo, where a new front is emerging at a distance of about 35 kilometers from the captured area west of Sudzha. The town of Otruba and its surroundings have been conquered by Ukraine, according to the DeepState analysis platform, which notes that six other kilometers and the town of Tétkino are in dispute. Ukrainian forces are now present west of the attacked district of Glushkovo and also east, where they continued to advance with the capture of the towns of Snagost and Apanasovka. Oleksandr Kovalenko, a military analyst, estimates that the Russian forces in the area are fewer than 15,000 soldiers. 'If Glushkovo falls under Ukrainian control, the total area captured in Kursk, over 1,500 square kilometers, will be greater than what Russia has captured in Ukraine in all of 2024,' he emphasized in his latest analysis for the 'Resistencia Informativa' group. Kovalenko argues that Russia has not transferred enough troops to the area to stop the Ukrainian advances, which have continued although their pace has slowed down after the first days of rapid progress. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said on Sunday that the operation aims to create a 'buffer zone' in Russian territory and weaken its military potential. 'We are achieving our objectives,' he emphasized on Monday after saying that more Russian soldiers have been taken prisoner in Kursk.
news knowledge.title: Ucrania expande su ofensiva en Kursk y trata de aislar y tomar Glushkovo - Mundo

news knowledge.eng_title: Ukrainian Forces Advance in Kursk Region, Capture New Villages

Organization: Institute for the Study of War

news knowledge.summary: Ukrainian forces continued their assault on the entire salient in the Kursk region, with minor advances on the southeast of Sudji, according to the Institute for the Study of War. 'On August 18, Ukrainian forces continued to assault the entire salient in the Kursk region and made minor advances southeast of Sudji,' the ISW report stated. Ukrainian forces have captured the villages of Troitskoye and Semenovka, with the latter being approximately 24 kilometers from the border. The Russian Ministry of Defense and milbloggers claimed that Ukrainian forces were shelling the areas around Korenevo, Komarovka, Olgovka, Alexeevka, Safonovka, Kromskie Byki, Kauchuk, Sheptukhovka, Cherkasskoye Porichye, Russkoye Porichye, Ozerki, Giry, and Borok. However, according to geolocation footage from August 17 and 18, Ukrainian forces have been operating 'within the maximum declared limit' of their advance in the Kursk region. A Russian war correspondent claimed that there is unconfirmed information that Ukrainian forces have entered the village of Otruba north of Tetkino, while another war correspondent stated that Ukrainian forces are operating near Tetkino. The commander of the PS, Nikolai Oleschuk, published geolocation footage from August 18, showing Ukrainian forces striking a bridge over the Seim River in Zvanoe. As reported by the DeepState on August 19, Ukrainian forces have expanded their foothold in the Kursk region, capturing three more villages. According to the head of the Sumy MVA, Alexei Drizdov, the breakthrough in the Kursk region is the first stage of the Ukrainian offensive, which caught the enemy off guard.'
news knowledge.title: ВСУ захватили новые населенные пункты в Курской области: где произошли продвижения (карта)

news knowledge.eng_title: Kursk Front: Destruction of M270 Rocket Launcher and Battles on Multiple Fronts
news knowledge.summary: On the Kursk front, ongoing battles continue. Russian forces destroyed a M270 rocket launcher in the Bездрик area of the Sumy region, which was discovered from the air and quickly hit with an 'Iskander' missile with an air-burst explosion. There were no visible changes in the combat situation in the Glushkovsky district by the end of the day. Russian forces are holding positions in Tetykino. There were reports of Ukrainian forces entering the town of Otroba on the right bank of the Seim River, but there is no objective confirmation. In the Korenevsky district, there are reports of clashes on the approaches to Korenevo. Although the information is fragmented, the battles seem logical in the context of the Ukrainian forces' attempts to capture the city. In the Sudzhansky district, new footage has appeared from the western districts of the city, including the evacuation of Russian prisoners and captured hostages from local residents in the direction of the Sumy region. Battles are ongoing near Martynovka, and south of Kremenno, FPV-drone operators destroyed a Ukrainian BMP-1. In the Belovsky district, battles are ongoing between the villages of Giry and Ozersk, with no information on changes to the front line configuration.
news knowledge.title: ❗️ Курское направление: уничтожение РСЗО М270 и бои на нескольких участках фронта, что известно исходу 17 августа 2024 года

news knowledge.eng_title: Ukrainian Military Allegedly Destroys Bridge on Kursk Region, Cutting Off Area
news knowledge.summary: Russian social media groups claim that the Ukrainian military allegedly destroyed a bridge over the Seim River near the village of Glushkovo in the Kursk region on August 16. The bridge is a crucial artery for civilian and military logistics in the area. Russian propagandists claim that the Ukrainian military allegedly fired several American HIMARS rockets at the bridge, as well as two MLRS projectiles, one of which allegedly hit a car carrying Russian 'volunteers'. After the last strike, one of the bridge's spans collapsed. The area is now cut off, affecting villages such as Tetkino, Popovo-Lyazhachi, Volfino, and 27 others. Russian propagandist Roman Alekhin claims that the Ukrainian military allegedly also attacked a bridge in the village of Zvane in the Glushkovsky district and plans to capture a section of the district along the Seim River. Russian military propagandists predict further Ukrainian actions, including taking control of the E38 highway and attacking from the Glukhov side. Analysts note that the Ukrainian military has successfully expanded its territory of operation to 1,150 square kilometers, with 507.76 square kilometers under Ukrainian control and 640.92 square kilometers in a 'gray zone'. Ukrainian forces are likely engaged in battles in the Korenevo area, where another Russian column was allegedly destroyed. Russians complain that Korenevo blocks the road to Rylsk, and that capturing Rylsk would leave a number of border posts in the area without supplies and support.
news knowledge.title: Россияне паникуют из-за разрушенного ВСУ моста на Курщине и "отрезанной" части района — online.ua

news knowledge.eng_title: Ukrainian Invasion of Kursk Region Repelled, Russian Forces Gain Ground
news knowledge.summary: The Ukrainian invasion of the Kursk region has been repelled, and the Ukrainian forces are now on the defensive. The Ukrainian army's plans to capture the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant have been foiled, and they are now trying to take the town of Korenevo. However, the Russian forces are putting up a strong resistance, and the Ukrainian army is suffering heavy losses. The Russian air force is also conducting airstrikes on Ukrainian positions in the Sumy region, disrupting their logistics and plans. The Ukrainian army's plans for a two-pronged attack, targeting both the Kursk and Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plants, are still unclear. However, a drone attack on the Zaporizhzhia plant on Sunday sparked a large fire, and the Ukrainian army may try to target the plant again. The Russian forces are also making gains on other fronts, including the Donetsk and Kherson regions. The Belarusian government has announced that it will be reinforcing its troops on the border with Ukraine in response to Ukrainian drone attacks on Belarusian airspace. This development may force the Ukrainian army to divert some of its troops to the north, which could be beneficial for the Russian forces.
news knowledge.title: НОВАЯ РЕАЛЬНОСТЬ ПОСЛЕ ОТЧАЯННОГО ВТОРЖЕНИЯ ВСУ В КУРСКУЮ ОБЛАСТЬ

news knowledge.eng_title: Ukrainian Forces Take Control of 28 Villages in Kursk Region
news knowledge.summary: According to Kursk Governor Alexei Smirnov, Ukrainian forces have taken control of 28 villages in the region. Smirnov stated, 'The situation in the region is quite difficult.' He also mentioned that 2,000 Russian citizens remain in the area, but their fate is unknown. Smirnov added, '59,000 people are still waiting to be evacuated from the Kursk region.' Since the start of the conflict, 121,000 people have been evacuated from the region. Smirnov announced that they have divided the relocation of the local population into two stages. The first stage includes four districts, a 10 km radius, as well as the entire Sudzha and Korenevo districts. Smirnov also stated that they have begun evacuating the entire border region and the areas near the nuclear power plant, including Bolshoe Soldatskoe and Lgov, starting on August 8. He reported that 12 civilians have been killed and 121 people have been injured in the region.
news knowledge.title: Ukrayna Birlikleri Kursk Bölgesinde Kontrolü Ele Geçirdi

news knowledge.eng_title: Ukrainian Military Plans to Capture Kursk Nuclear Power Plant
news knowledge.summary: The Ukrainian military is reportedly planning to capture the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant, located 80 km from the city of Sudja, in the Kursk region. The plant has been a target of Ukrainian military operations, with Russian sources claiming that over 300 Ukrainian soldiers and equipment have been spotted in the area. The region has seen an increase in civilian casualties, with 28 people injured in the Sudja and Korenev regions. Ukrainian social media channels have shared footage of allegedly captured Russian soldiers, while also circulating a deepfake video of the regional governor, Alexei Smirnov, urging men over 18 to take up arms. This comes after reports of three conscripts from the Ural region being killed in the Belgorod region while carrying out orders from their superiors.
news knowledge.title: ВСУ планируют захватить Курскую АЭС
